events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application online, indicating a need for funds to cover upcoming medical expenses.
The loan processing system automatically categorised the application as a Personal Loan based on keywords related to medical and personal use.
Loan officer Sarah Mitchell was assigned to handle the personal loan application to ensure personalized follow-up and assessment.
The initial review involved verifying the completeness of the application and confirming the applicant's stated purpose is for medical expenses.
Additional documents requested from the applicant included recent medical bills and proof of income to support loan processing.
Applicant submitted all requested documents promptly, including hospital statements and salary slips, aiding smooth progress.
Credit bureau report was obtained, showing a satisfactory credit score and no recent delinquencies or defaults.
Risk model assessed the applicant’s ability to repay loan favorably due to stable employment and manageable debt levels.
A tailored loan offer was presented to the applicant, including details on interest rate, tenure, and repayment schedule.
Applicant responded with acceptance of the proposed loan terms and expressed gratitude for the quick processing.
Due to the loan amount requested exceeding the standard approval limit, the case was escalated for senior management review.
Senior management approved the loan application after reviewing all documents and confirming financial viability.
Funds were successfully disbursed to the applicant’s designated bank account to cover medical and personal expenses.
Customer service contacted the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and offer assistance with repayment options if needed.
The loan application process was officially closed after all steps were completed and the customer expressed satisfaction.
